justification: “The psychometric structure of ISP was studied… using the ‘Intersession Experience Questionnaire’ (IEQ… ). The IEQ makes it possible to describe and measure ISP in a comprehensive form.”
“Short Intersession Process Scale (SIPS). The SIPS is a short scale with ten items for assessing various aspects of intersession processes in psychotherapy.”
“PHQ-9. For daily measurement of symptom stress, we decided to use a well-validated measure of major depression.”
“For daily assessment of anxiety symptoms, we used another short measure, the GAD-7… shown to be of good psychometric quality.”
“SAD-D. For social anxiety symptoms, we used a ten-item severity measure… This scale assesses cognitive, behavioral and affective symptoms of social anxiety disorder.”
“The diagnostic instruments… included… the Hamilton rating scales for anxiety and depression (HAM-A, HAM-D…).”
Same sentence notes that HAM-D was employed for depression at intake and termination.
“The diagnostic instruments at admission and termination included the structured clinical interview MINI-DIPS… All participants fulfilled diagnostic criteria…”
